revised_title: Condensation Reactions of Chloral with Urea and Phenyl Urea
tldr: The article discusses the condensation reactions of chloral with urea and phenyl urea, resulting in the formation of various compounds. The reactions involve the formation of monochloral urea, dichloral urea, and ether-like compounds. The study also explores the properties and reactions of these compounds, including their solubility, hydrolysis, and reactions with acetic anhydride and sodium alkoxides.
